properties.areaDesc: Douglas; Osage; Shawnee; Franklin; Jefferson; Anderson; Coffey
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 3:50PM CST until February 5 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Several rounds of winter precipitation to impact the region...

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected on Tuesday and snow on
Wednesday. Total combined snow accumulations for both days will
be one to two inches and ice accumulations on Tuesday will be
up to one tenth of an inch.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Kansas.

* WHEN...A mixture of snow and freezing drizzle begins midday
Tuesday and persists through the afternoon. There will likely be
a break in the precipitation Tuesday night before a second round
of snow lifts through during the day on Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TUESDAY TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY
